SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Control the Specific HTML Served for Bot-Enabled Pages and Components

Fine-tune the HTML output of the searchable content served directly to search engine bots that are crawling your storefront pages. You can create your own Visualforce pages and components for serving bot-enabled content, and override the default bot-enabled pages and components that B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides. Ensure that search engines crawl the exact semantic content that you want them to see.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce didn't provide any override of the default bot-enabled pages or components, other than the values of certain <meta> tags.

How: After you update the available global data, the following storefront configuration settings are available under the User Interface module:

Bot Breadcrumb Template
Bot Category Tree Template
Bot Footer Template
Bot Header Template
Bot Home Page Template
Bot Product Detail Page Template
Bot Product List Page Template

For each of these settings, enter the name of your custom Visualforce page or component. Prefix each name with c__, such as c__myBotHomePage.

NOTE The Bot Footer Template component controls the same content as the CC Rich Contents bot-enabled footer record added in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ‘19 (version 4.10). If you previously used this record to provide footer content for bot-enabled pages, you can continue using it. Alternatively, you can migrate that record's content to a Bot Footer Template override.
SEE ALSO
Override the Default Bot-Enabled Pages or Components
Create Simple Footer Content for Bot-Enabled Pages
